p: Territory of Washigton} In the District Court of the County of Spokane}ss 4th Judicial District holding terms at County Seat of Spokane County

Territory of Washington vs. Plaintiff Ray Raymond Defendant</
Territory of Washington} County of Spokane}ss
J. Kennedy Stout and Thomas C. Griffitts, being first duly sworn on oath state we have had the affidavit of T. Donaldson George Wycoff anf S.C. Hyde herein filed and know the contents thereof. That they and each of them were present together at the interview between them & said Donaldson at his hom in Richland Precinct and at the interview at the home of defendant spoken of in the said affidavit of Donaldson. That said first conversation did place on the 9th day of August 1886. The affidavit were led to find said Donaldson by information received by them that he had declared he was present at time of the shooting that in said interview said Donaldson did not know affiant that Wycoff witnessed the killing, but on the contrary did tell them that he occupied a position where it would have been impossible for
him to have seen a part of the scuffle or shooting or that it would not be worth her while to see Wycoff as he knew nothing about it and subsequently and about the time of the interview at the "Bay Windows" spoken of in Donaldson affidavit said Donaldson himself told affiants that said Wycoff was gone from his hand and to Walla Walla County somewhere harvesting notwithstanding and as soon as he knew of his return would inform affiant and he never did inform affiants that he had so returned until after the finding of this indictment. That in said interview in Richland Precinct said Donaldson did not tell affiants that he witnessed said shooting byt made quite contrary statements to that and while alleying he was present his statement were so understanding and instatement in themselves an to action did of known facts in the case that affiants can obtain no such statment from him whereupon to declared if he could on the premise he would explain and reside his testimony and it is permanent there that the interview and
hold in the "Bay Windoes" and which considered as will on the statement again to Donaldson where by of a view of the premises, that the atatement of said Donaldson were not in any manner cleared up by luck view of the presmises byt appeared here in consistent than ever or such as That in several days after the finding of this indictment affiant Thomas C. Griffitts came from said Donaldson. That several days after the finding of this indictment affiant finds as late at the 8th day of this month that affiants learned that said Donaldson would be a witness for the prosecution and that he claimed to be an eye-witness to the ahooting anf this was the first any of defendants counsel or defendant knew that he would be a witness in this cause or that they did not know Wycoff by sight nor did they knowledge except Donaldson who did know him by sight and had no means of finding him until after they were informed by the sheriff that and either of affiants now and him to know him until he was he was on Spokane Falls which was about the time stated in their previous affidavit herein, that defendants counsel were well known to all persons in attendance upon this court and said Wycoff did not make himself know either to defendant or any of her counsel although subpoenas to attend at her behalf, that the prosecuting attorney has
never notified defendant or her attorneys of his purpose to use said witnesses Donaldson & Wycoff or either of the or of what he expected to prove by them and they only learned if at first incidentally and inquiry disclosed the fact that they were Donaldson was so attending this court for said purpose. That the presence of said Donaldson in Spokane Falls and about the court room did not inform affiants of any thing as his presence in Spokane Falls was not unusual. J. Kennedy Stout Thomas C. Griffitts That about the time affiant have been confined to prove resident in this county, at last to
Subscribed and sworn to upon me that 16th day of December 1886
Frank Hulous Notary Public Wash Ter
